availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Georgiana Taylor. Father of James Taylor, Sarah Taylor, Elizabeth Taylor, Rebecca Taylor, and Caroline Taylor. Member of a committee to draft resolutions for friends of emancipation and colonization in Mercer County in 1849. Attorney in Mercer County in 1850. Appointed Commissioner to divide Mercer County into election districts in 1850. Member of Board of Directors of Harrodsburg Savings Institution. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1850 and ten enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, page 19.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, page 3.
The Louisville Daily Courier, "Public Meeting in Mercer," April 19, 1849, page 2.
